column1: 1$Condition: Other$4/28/2012 2:53:57 AM$Reviewer: Why Not? BP aTX
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have ADD not ADHD.  This medication works much better than adderall or ritalin. I've taken the non ER type and it is not as effective.  I take the ER in the morning and it lasts all day.  I can take one at lunch if I want/need to.  I do not feel speeded up anxious.  I concentrate and focus rather than start six things and only finish one.  It does not make me feel high either.  My ADD is intensified by Bipolar 1 late onset.  Some days before I got on Methylin ER I was a total mess. I got nothing done for days. And I tried. I got overwhelmed by the simplest tasks which added up to a mountain that went volcano and erupted on me. Even if the tasks were simply daily living. I was/am a professional (lawyer) this drug has allowed me to do pro bono legal work again and work part time in a non legal setting. I keep my home and life in much better order. All the while I don't feel high or amped. It has been a lifesaver.

column1: 2$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/12/2012 8:51:04 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $2$3$5$

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Made more room in my brain so I can stop and focus on what I'm doing before I act on it.

column1: 4$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/21/2010 2:58:36 PM$Reviewer: Pgrad
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $4$4$4$My 12yo daughter has taken this med for the past 2 1/2 years. We have increased to 27mg per day (due to growth). We definitely notice a difference if she hasnt taken them for a day (lack of impulse control
column4: high energy). The tablets are small enough for her to swallow with minimal effort
column5: which is a plus! She has had a significant growth spurt as she nears puberty
column6: so difficult to tell if weight gain is due to the meds (I think mostly not). She does complain of headaches occasionally. Overall
column7: we have been satisfied with this medication.

column1: 5$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/2/2010 8:04:05 AM$Reviewer: suzette
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $4$4$5$My son is 13 now and he has been on other meds for his ADHD and they worked just as well as the Methylin ER so the switch to this medication was mostly for economical reasons (the co-pay for the other meds was too high).It keeps my son focused and less hyperactive throughout most of the day. However
column3: the one benefit I see to this med over the others is that his appetite has increased.  On the other meds
column4: he barely ate and he was under-weight for his age.  Now he has gained a few pounds and has grown a few inches in the last 6 months. I think we'll stick with this one for a while.

column1: 6$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/25/2010 11:05:41 AM$Reviewer: Aspie
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Awesome drug
column5: the least expensive - very smooth and lasts a good 6-8 hours
column6: so I take the IR in the afternoon as a booster.

column1: 7$Condition: Other$5/14/2010 11:39:10 AM$Reviewer: sunnyplace
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I am using this drug for depression. I feel more energetic and optomistic after one month of 40 mg per day. My Dr. monitors my reaction
column3: blood pressure and heart rate every month before another dose.

column1: 8$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/12/2010 4:14:15 PM$Reviewer: None
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$"I'm 36 yrs old. ADD my whole life. I have taken Dexedrine
column4: and finally Vyvanse.  So far Methylin ER is the least ""edgy"".  Seems mild while still helping me focus at work. I haven't had wierd thoughts so far like on the other meds. Feel more ""normal""."

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$2$I suffer from depression and ADD (no hyperactivity) was taking adderall for the last couple of years and it was much more effective than this. Also I was told to take it 3xs a day and it's difficult to remember to stop what I'm doing to take it all 3xs.  I am tired all day no matter how much sleep I get and my focusing is only slightly better.

column5: I suffer from Severe Depresion and Bi-Polar Disorder.  I take this to boost the Pristiq and the Geodon.  It lifts my mood and helps me to focus on life rather tham my depression. I thank-God for this medication.  It saved my life
column6: literally.  It makes me feel like life is worth living again.

column1: 12$Condition: Other$7/21/2009 11:19:41 AM$Reviewer: caboose313
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"i am prescribed to 20mg methylin ER twice a day
column3: but the dr told me i could take 2 at once or something like that just dont go over 40mg a day
column4: this is a great drug for people that need it
column6: and a person should know what theyre doing before they get a script to it
column7: i became dependant after a month of straight use
column8: but after i realized that it was getting to be that way i stopped taking them for a few weeks and only take them when i am going to need to do something
column10: that day. but since they are the backbone chemical to methamphetamines they shouldnt be given to young children
column11: but my story.. i have suffered from severe social anxiety and depression along with a case of ADD
column12: i used to take zoloft to try to combat the depression and anxiety and have experimented with xanax
column14: ect.. and all those pills just turned me into a different person
column15: the zoloft turned me into a heavy drinker
column16: and the benzos turned me into a zombie. the methylin is different it is a upper for me and i have so much energy
column18: confidence. i feel like i can do anything i set my mind to so to speak. but there are some downfalls to it
column19: you get a hell of a cotton mouth
column20: the comedown is horrible and you just want to sleep
column21: and for me there was a couple sexual problems but it only happened once when i hadnt taken the script in about 3 weeks so there was no tolerance
column22: but if there isnt the difficulty in bed with it
column23: it makes sex a million times better
column24: you have so much energy and just never runs out for a few hours which is longer than id like to be there haha
column25: there is also a drop in appetite
column26: which for some ppl is a good thing but i'm 5""10 and 120lbs and was 135lbs before i started taking it
column27: it would be good to pair it with a THC pill. but overall it is a wonderful drug for people who need it and is not to be abused. theres no point in getting tweaked out on rittalin. when u take too many you feel like ur alive and moving but out of ur head."

column1: 14$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/3/2008 6:54:05 AM$Reviewer: onetogo
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $5$5$5$Once my son started high school I knew he needed to be assessed for ADHD. In the first 5 weeks of the school year he was failing 3 classes. As soon as he started taking just 10mg of Methylin ER he could focus and made the honor roll. The effects last the entire school day. He struggles a bit to concentrate on homework
column3: but so far it's  manageable. He has put on 10 pound in 6 weeks though. He isn't hungry all day
column4: but pigs out in the evenings.

column1: 19$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/29/2008 1:23:31 AM$Reviewer: proudmom0005
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $2$1$4$My son was diagnosed with ADHD July 2007.  I didn't think I would ever medicate my child in this way but I'm glad that I have because he is more focused and less aggressive (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THIS MEDICATION).  In the short time since his diagnoses
column3: we have tried about 4 different medications and this particular drug has been the least effective. He acts as if he's not currently taking any medication.  In the 1 month that he's been on this drug he has shown severe aggression towards his 2 yr old brother and has been very whiny.  The medication that has been the most effective is Metadate CD.  He was doing great in school and wonderful with his little brother.  Starting tomorrow morning we're going to try Conterta but if this fails we'll go back to Metadate CD in a heartbeat.
